text: hi my name is David Gordon Green I'm the
director of the film Joe so this scene
is leading up to the moment where
Nicholas Cage's character and ty
Sheridan's character meet each other
physically for the first time you'll see
this work crew that Nick is working with
he's kind of the leader of a band of
tree poisoners and all these guys are
non-traditional actors the foreman jr.
was a guy that owns a barbecue
restaurant in Austin a lot of it other
guys were day laborers that we'd get
downtown we really wanted the
authenticity of people that knew how to
work not just guys I had had the skill
set on their on their acting headshot
and resume sometimes that can be a
little misleading so we got these guys
that really brought a wonderful
naturalism and authenticity ty Sheridan
is an awesome young actor that I first
noticed in the movie Tree of Life and
then in the film mud I was in the
editing room on that film a little bit
with Jeff Nichols and I'm really taken
by him as enthusiasm as a young actor
his talent and thought this would be a
great guy to go up against Nicolas Cage
in the movie the snake that he uses here
as a real venomous cottonmouth snake we
had it there just to shoot some
close-ups for some b-roll and Nick
insisted on using it as a prop which
that was very bold and fascinating he
didn't want to use the rubber snake for
the close-up you get bit by those you're
gonna die you don't wanna die so he's
holding this snake that uh you know
could have with one bite taking him out
